#stalksandroots #flowerstagram #flower #flowers #flowerphotography #floweroftheday #copenhagen #flower_daily #flowerpower #torvehallerne #interior #interiordesignğŸ˜‹E A S Y  T O  E N J O YğŸ˜‹
Are you looking for Danish delicacies, local vegetables, fresh fish, or maybe some Italian specialities? Then visit Copenhagen's popular market place Torvehallerne. 
Torvehallerne is situated right by NÃ¸rreport Station, and offers more than 80 shops.
Several Copenhagen shops are also present at Torvehallerne, and among others you will find the tea shop Tante T, Cofoco SupermarchÃ© and the famous chocolate Summerbird. 
Torvehallerne were designed by architect Hans Hagens and opened in September 2011.
#torvehallerne #easytoenjoy #cph #comfortvesterbro #copenhagen #comforthotelvesterbro #urbaneasyliving #nordicchoice #nordicchoicehotelsTORVEHALLERNE, Copenhagen
.
The first stop of our 48 hours in Copenhagen. An awesome food market with dozens of purveyors of the best local and international dishes. .

#valentinesday2019 #Champagne #andrÃ©clouet #torvehallerne #hav #rossinicaviar  #rogn #kÃ¦rlighed #vispiserhjemmeidag #godmadogvin #leisnerwine #godmad #hygge #danskmad #danishfood #copenhagenfood #copenhagen #hygge #lÃ¦kkermad #vihardetgodt #enrejseStumbled upon a great independent bottling company @noorbohandelen.dk during my trip to Copenhagen. All their spirits are selected by hand, from beautiful Islay casks to rum barrels and they even make their own Aquavit!
Ë™
I had the pleasure of tasting a 18 year old Linkwood, distilled in '95 and bottled in 2013. It has quiet the strength on 48,3% ABV. Nevertheless, it is a light and delicate malt with the aroma of honey, stone fruit, vanilla and beeswax. The beeswax results in a very coating mouthfeel, accompanied by vanilla, some wood, marzipan and a peppery finish.
Ë™
Although Denmark is the land of Aquavit (a local colorless spirit with a lot of herbs), I couldn't resist this beautiful dram!
Ë™

MULGEO BLINIS at Torvehallerne 
Come taste our delicious blinis topped with high quality local produce, such as seasonal vegetables, microgreens, mushrooms, meat, fish, shellfish, and roe. 
Lumpfish roe is known as Nordic caviar and the season for this flavorful ingredient begins now, making it just the right time to open Copenhagenâ€™s first blini bar. 
We are looking forward to celebrating our new food concept with you. Come and taste it for yourself!Oranges and lemons...ğŸŠğŸ‹ juicy pickings @torvehallernekbh market - a must visit on your list if you go to Copenhagen!Donâ€™t miss to taste our SCALLOP & FENNEL blinis by @kevinkroloekke with sweet potato pure and dry sea lettuce by @dansktang_danishseaweed

Breaking news! Clevers Meat in Torvehallerne is selling Cumberland Sausages. Made by the fabulous Stephan from Hertfordshire, they are available now.  The current batch has garlic, great for keeping the vampires away, and there is talk of pork and leek and pork and apple. #gourmetAugust 2018 ğŸ›«ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡°
We decided to visit #scandinavia so we started from #copenhagen .
We got there by plane; we took an @easyjet flight from Venezia Marco Polo to Copenhagen Airport. Just from the airport, we took the train which left us right in the city... no way to travel better than that!!!
As always, we had booked a flat through @airbnb and this time our host was fantastic!! On the second day, we took the free walking tour by @sandemansnewcopenhagen. We walked around the city for 3 hour and visited the most important landmarks... Simply amazing!!
As we had two more days, we visited:
ğŸ“The little Mermaid (which is actually really small... it might me smaller than me, and I'm 1.53mts tallğŸ¤·ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸)
ğŸ“Christiania (a neighbourhood where you cannot take pictures due to the neighbours' strict rules, but you can walk freely without any problem)
ğŸ“Torvehallerne (Fresh food market - super!!)
ğŸ“Tivoli Gardens
ğŸ“Frederiks Kirke (Ivory church)
ğŸ“Von Frelsers Kirke (baroque church - fantastic view of the city!)
ğŸ“etc etc etc...
And anywhere you want to get lost on foot or by bike. We highly recommend @donkey_republic; the best bike service in the city!! ...

You are not your thought, you are the awareness. Be aware of your thoughts.Â ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ A simple question you can ask in meditation when you get caught up with your mind: Do I need that thought right now? If the answer is no, let go of the thought. Once there is a new one, feel free to ask yourself the same question. Bring your awareness into the present moment and enjoy it without worrying about past or future. There is only now.

#stalksandroots #flowerstagram #flowers #flower #flowerphotography #floweroftheday #copenhagen #flower_daily #torvehallerne #interior #interiordesignI can't believe it's been almost a year since I touched down in Copenhagen.
I was staying at a great hostel only a block or two away from the train station and because I arrived before check in time I dropped my carry-on in a locker, plugged in my headphones, and took off in a drizzle of rain for @torvehallernekbh.
The hygge there warmed me to my core and it was the most PERFECT place to dry out, wander between stalls, try some killer local cuisine, and get mistaken for a local. 
So "on this merry night
Let us clink and drink one down
To wonderful, wonderful Copenhagen
Salty old queen of the sea
Once I sailed away
But I'm home today
Singing Copenhagen, wonderful, wonderful
Copenhagen for me". It's a famous song. Look it up.

Copenhagen is the coolest town to visit in 2019, says Lonely Planet, and they sure did see many others first ;-) For us, itâ€™s more like our second home or third, and seeing these giant pumpkins outside the Tivoli Gardens downtown guess-where made us feel even more at home yesterday, since my sister produced 50 or so of these b-iiiiii-g costumes for the first Halloween opening of the old gardens back in 2013. Were we all proud of her? I think so, we still are each year theyâ€™re up, and now we proudly sell our champagne a few meters further down the road. Small world after all, remember to visit Tivoli and when youâ€™re done, it may be champagne oâ€™clock at le Petit vinbar in the Tivoli Food Hall. Scary Halloween to all who are into this playful monster mood.

The AW18 collection is therefore the last collection from UBANG. 
The decision was hard to take, but nevertheless so right, and I am exited by all the new opportunities ... First step on the new journey was the opening of my UBANG Chp Shop located in Vendersgade 17, 1363 CPH K. (Do follow @ubang_cphshop)
Here I will be having a permanent stock sale of the leftovers from previous collections, and a nice presentation of the AW18 collection...I will be in the shop a new days a week, and working on new projects the rest of  the time.

And when the stock is gone? Well that is what is most exciting as it is still open and unknown. I am brewing on different ideas...
One thing is for sure, my new  life must include ceramics, one way or another ... So I better speed up learning more of this amazing craft...

#copenhagenYes, another #kombucha post !
I found this amazing drink, made by @nordicfermentation at #torvehallerne . It is made with just #raw products - their own produced raw honey and local #berries . The thing I like about it - it is not super sweet as the ones made with sugar and you can feel better the nice berriesâ€™ aroma and the real kombucha taste. Itâ€™s completely #organic and no CO2 is added. I have tried many and this one is on my top list now <3

'Copenhagen, Denmarkâ€™s capital, sits on the coastal islands of Zealand and Amager. Itâ€™s linked to Malmo in southern Sweden by the Ã–resund Bridge. Indre By, the city's historic center, contains Frederiksstaden, an 18th-century rococo district, home to the royal familyâ€™s Amalienborg Palace.Nearby is Christiansborg Palace and the Renaissance-era Rosenborg Castle, surrounded by gardens and home to the crown jewels.' Google says ğŸ˜ I came to know Copenhagen as a food lovers heaven with idyllic snow covered streets that remind me of Jason Bourne and the best lattes I've ever had from the coffee collective in Torvehallerne. The city was so well laid out with worldly shops, open people who loved talking about their travels, what parts of the city I should visit next and of course.. Bikes! I also remember the warm respite of the botanical gardens as we walked the streets during a cold snap in March and couldn't believe my eyes or ears when we heard the European police sirens, something I know means it should be bad, but always makes me smile because it reminds me of all the foreign movies I love. I miss you, Copenhagen! .
.

A "SmÃ¸rrebrÃ¸d" is a Danish open sandwich which usually consists of a base of buttered rye bread, decorated with an assortment of cold cuts, meat, fish, cheese or spreads. 
These beautifully presented incredible edibles caught my eye whilst schmoozing through Torvehallerne, Copenhagen's fresh food market.

If you haven't been, go! A treat for the eye and the stomach.

This shrimp smorrebrod consists of buttered rye bread with a mountain of hand peeled shrimps and dill covered in a light cream/mayo sauce.  Comes with a slice of lemon on the side.  It is refreshing, tasty and filling.  This sandwich is light in flavor, not overwhelming, and the focus is on the fresh shrimps and its perfect texture.

#stalksandroots #dahlia #georginer #flowersofinstagram #flowers #flower #interior #interiordesign #copenhagen #flower_daily #flowerpower #torvehallerneğŸŒ¶THIS FRIDAY AT BRAZARIA ğŸŒ¶  Brazaria is throwing a wonderful late afternoon outdoor BBQ accompanied by Dj Anders Winkler, who is flipping old original vinyl from South America to the sound from the crackling fire, and the smell from the tender meat on the grill. ğŸ”¥

We line up with a lavish BBQ menu, and our our bar is serving chilled cocktails and bubbles ğŸ¹ğŸ¸ğŸ¾ ğŸ˜‹. Salsa Picante - Menu. ğŸ´Picada Grill:
Homemade Chorizo, Grilled cheese, Chimichurri, Padrons, Amarillo mayo kr. 125.- ğŸ´Picada Royal :
Beef, Slow cooked Pork, Homemade Chorizo, Chicken, Padrons, Chimichurri, Amarillo mayo kr. 250. ğŸ´Argentine Giant Shrimps, Chimichurri, Amarillo mayo kr. 150.- ğŸ´Sweet potatoes fries, Amarillo mayo kr. 50.- â­ï¸About Dj Anders Winkler â­ï¸
"Grooveyvibesman" is the moniker of Anders Winkler, a record collector who just recently returned from Columbia with a big bag of old traditional sunshine music. ğŸ¤—ğŸ‘‰This Friday he will be playing an arousing mix of finds from Medillin containing music from Columbia and adjacent countries from 1940 - 1985. The set is made by crate digging the streets of downtown San Antonio and will make a delicate introduction to the music of Latin America by combining Salsa, Bossa, Afro-Cuban and Cumbia. This will definitely contain lots of delicious horns, delirious rhythms and happy vocals. ğŸŒğŸ’ƒğŸ¼ Come join us for a latesummer afternoon/evening at Brazaria/Torvehallerne. 
With love

Rose petals are popular in Middle Eastern cooking, but they have a wide variety of uses further abroad. They make a good flavouring for jams, syrups, and desserts, and can be eaten fresh on salads or cooked into liquids.

Massage on back, neck, shoulders remove the side effects of a big mental and physical stress. It is recommended both to cure and prevent. This pleasant form of relaxation is right where the neck muscles, trapezius muscle and back muscles are stiff because of the single-load, prolonged stay in a sitting position, stress or long hours spent in front of a computer. It brings relief from headaches and cervical spine, helps in correct breathing and maintaining proper posture, removes accumulated stress, relaxed and improves the condition of the mind.

Fenugreek is a pungent addition to food, and popular in Middle Eastern, Mediterranean and Indian cooking. The seeds are yellow-brown and when ground feature prominently in many commercial curry powders. The deep, strong, nutty flavour complements many eastern and western dishes.

#smorgasbord #copenhagen #torvehallerneBurro bananas have very little fat and are very low in calories. They are high in potassium and also contain a significant amount of vitamin B, vitamin C, fiber and magnesium. They also contain amounts of phosphorous, magnesium, calcium, iron, zinc, copper and selenium.

Not all is lost â˜€ï¸ I think in my last post I made it seem like this trip was horrible but it wasnâ€™t. I did enjoy it, I have an experience to share and people to remember. While here I walked to a market for 30 minutes everyday  because it was the closest food market (kinda understand why people bike everywhere)ğŸ™ƒ this food market had everything from traditional danish food to Mexican tacos. You buy food here and then go eat it at the park nearby. One thing I enjoyed here itâ€™s how relaxed and chilled people are. Like extremely chilled...men walking around shirtless and all, midday. Must be that free health and education system. Also the weather was so much nicer than NY, I got tanned just by walking around. During the summer, the sun sets around 12am and thatâ€™s where the fun starts....somewhat. But now Iâ€™m paying off all those sleepless nights with this jet lag ğŸ˜­When itâ€™s market time in Copenhagen .
